thread.title: James Ellington: British sprinter takes first steps after motorbike crash
thread.title_full: James Ellington: British sprinter takes first steps after motorbike crash

title: James Ellington: British sprinter takes first steps after motorbike crash
text:
Read more about sharing. James Ellington is a 100m and 200m specialist and a two-time Olympian having competed at Rio 2016 and London 2012 British sprinter James Ellington says he will return to athletics in 2018 after breaking his pelvis and both legs in a motorbike crash two weeks ago. 
The 31-year-old Olympian says he "can't believe" his progress, having taken his first steps on Wednesday. 
In an Instagram post, Ellington said he was expected to be "in a wheelchair for at least six weeks" before he attempted walking. 
Fellow sprinter Nigel Levine, 27, was also involved in the head-on collision. 
Any pelvic injuries to sprinters are potentially career-threatening and both athletes will need significant rehabilitation. Ellington takes his first steps after surgery using bars for support Share this page
